intro: Knautia sylvatica proles rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered wood knautia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink to rose-colored flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features upright stems with serrated, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy to the touch. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Knautia sylvatica proles rosea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
